thread.title: Jets rookie Patrik Laine will play versus Sharks
thread.title_full: Jets rookie Patrik Laine will play versus Sharks

author: Andrew Bottomley
title: Jets rookie Patrik Laine will play versus Sharks
text:
Presented by: Jets rookie Patrik Laine will play versus Sharks 
Winnipeg Jets head coach Paul Maurice says they’ve pushed Patrik Laine really hard at practice, and he’s responded really well, and could be ready for Tuesday’s 2nd game of the club’s back-to-back. January 24, 2017, 6:16 PM Andrew Bottomley January 24, 2017, 6:16 PM 
Winnipeg Jets forward Patrik Laine will play on Tuesday night against the San Jose Sharks. "He's in." 
— Winnipeg Jets (@NHLJets) January 24, 2017 
Laine last played on Jan. 7 when he suffered a concussion after a devastating open-ice hit from Jake McCabe during the Jets' game against the Buffalo Sabres. The 18-year-old rookie missed eight games where the team went 3-4-1. 
Now healthy, Laine (21 goals, 16 assists) can try to pick up where he left off in the rookie scoring race, he currently sits in third behind Toronto Maple Leafs rookies Mitch Marner (38) and Auston Matthews (37). He is also scheduled to participate in All-Star Weekend beginning on Saturday. %2Fhockey%2Fnhl%2Fjets-rookie-patrik-laine-will-play-versus-sharks%2F
